result.execSummary:
The defendant Cliffton Jerome Spencer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by May 21, 2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by May 21, 2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Restitution set at zero.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 23 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work, work crews.
 FORTHWITH.
Court does not object to defendant release to the Day Reporting Center.
Court does not object electronic monitoring with release for: work, AODA treatment, medical care and child care.
No drivers license suspension.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cliffton Jerome Spencer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cliffton Jerome Spencer in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Cliffton Jerome Spencer in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
 
The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 5 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 23 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work, work crews. FORTHWITH.
-Court does not object to defendant release to the Day Reporting Center
-Court does not object electronic monitoring with release for: work, AODA treatment, Medical care and child care
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by May 21, 2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by May 21, 2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution set at zero
-no drivers license suspension

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Cliffton Jerome Spencer in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Cliffton Jerome Spencer in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court ordered restitution set at zero.
Case calendared for SENTENCING on 5/21/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Cliffton Jerome Spencer not in court, in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 15.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Cliffton Jerome Spencer not in court, in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont appeared for atty Sargent.  Defense request for an adjourned status date is granted by the court.    Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 15  Status conference scheduled for 04-16-2015 at 08:30 am.
Certification of PRELIMINIARY HEARING transcript commencing 3-26-15 received and filed. (14 Pages.)

Defendant Cliffton Jerome Spencer in court with attorney Louis Epps for Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Cliffton Jerome Spencer in custody.  Ron Dague for Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #12CF1759 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:David Cefalu-Wauwatosa Police Department Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cliffton Jerome Spencer in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Cliffton Jerome Spencer in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #12CF1759 that are attached to the complaint. State informed the Court that the subpeonaed officer was not available to attend today's proceedings.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE. Case adjoured for continued preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Cliffton Jerome Spencer in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Cliffton Jerome Spencer in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
